data.text: @prasannavishy All this means is that new variants will start spinning around from China.

@prasannavishy the point is simply, let us not get ahead of ourselves in saying that we are safe. I'm not making a major argument here, just acknowledging that covid is not over yet
I don't see the point of comparison in any case (wide range of supply chain patterns, but again, not going there)

@Meetasengupta What is the point?. Many cities in India (some with twice/thrice the population of HK) didn’t have food shortages even with higher caseload. Vaccine coverage in big Indian metros is comparable or better than HK.
@prasannavishy All for what? I’ll tell you. Compare IN deaths per capita with HK, or CHN. Oh, and use the excess mortality numbers for the real picture.

@prasannavishy Fingers crossed. This time last year we were claiming 'we got away' in India, and then Delta laid us low. Don't tempt the fates. (I'm not even going down the vaccination data, masking discussions) 
Just quietly hope the safe times last and get safer.
